experience.title: Machine Vision Intern
experience.description: Anomaly Detection in Videos using Convolutional Autoencoders‚Ä¢Devised an end-to-end unsupervised application for detecting and localizing anomalies in videos using the reconstruction error approach‚Ä¢Assembled 3D Convolution and 2D ConvLSTM layers in the autoencoder to retain the Spatio-temporal features throughout the layers of the model‚Ä¢Localized anomalies by thresholding the SSIM error map and then indicating anomalous pixels using rectangular contours in the frame
experience.description_html: Anomaly Detection in Videos using Convolutional Autoencoders‚Ä¢Devised an end-to-end unsupervised application for detecting and localizing anomalies in videos using the reconstruction error approach‚Ä¢Assembled 3D Convolution and 2D ConvLSTM layers in the autoencoder to retain the Spatio-temporal features throughout the layers of the model‚Ä¢Localized anomalies by thresholding the SSIM error map and then indicating anomalous pixels using rectangular contours in the frame <!---->

experience.title: General Secretary Technology
experience.description: ‚Ä¢ Solely responsible for smooth conduction of all 10 Technology General Championship events in my hall. ‚Ä¢ Efficiently managed a budget of INR 2 Lakh.‚Ä¢ Under my supervision, I ensured that my hall always competes in the event by guiding the teams to prepare top quality reports and presentations without any delay in submission.‚Ä¢ Organised Intra Hall Case Study competition which saw a participation of 15+ teams from the hall.‚Ä¢  Represented my hall in the Technology Subcommittee meetings in which all the rules and regulations related to the smooth functioning of the Technology General Championship are discussed.

recommendations: Avirup Mondal ‚ÄúPrathamesh has worked with us for one month, but have created an everlasting impact and the foundation of our fast-growing freelancing community. He was diligent, persistent and a team player. I really enjoyed working with him. One of the smartest guy who can be trusted :) I wish Prathamesh all the very best for all his future endeavours! ‚Äù

Dr. Karthik Seemakurthy ‚ÄúI supervised Prathamesh for his internship at TCS Research and Innovation Labs. The words that best describes Prathamesh are hardwork, perseverance, humble, and obedient. He was one of the best interns that I supervised in the last three years. What I personally like in him is his eagerness to learn new things. Being coming from chemical engineering background, he gave his best efforts to execute the task assigned to him and produced promising results for detecting anomalies from surveillance videos. Prathamesh will be a great asset to any team he works with. ‚Äù
projects: [{"title":"NLP based Legal Search Engine ","start_date":"Mar 2019","description":"‚Ä¢Part of the team which won a Gold medal among 15 other teams in the Inter-Hall Opensoft Competition, 2019 for making NLP based Legal Search Engine for lawyers and also for the common man so that they can search past 53000 supreme court cases.‚Ä¢Relevant results were obtained using the Okapi BM25 searching and ranking algorithm. The results can also be filtered according to the Judge's name, Date of the judgment, type of case, etc.‚Ä¢Integrated modules such as Spell-Checker (Peter Norvig's Algorithm), Abbreviation handler, automatic summarization in the application.‚Ä¢Was offered a research project under Prof. Saptarshi Ghosh, Department of Computer Science and Engineering."},{},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Digitalising doctor's handwritten prescription using OpenCV","start_date":"Mar 2017","description":"‚Ä¢Built a python based application which digitalizes doctor's handwritten prescription using OpenCV for preprocessing and Microsoft Azure Vision API for text recognition(OCR).‚Ä¢Conceptualized an error correction algorithm that corrects the detected words using a medical dictionary that maps medicines to symptoms of a disease.‚Ä¢Achieved an accuracy of 74.3 % which is significantly higher than Vision API's accuracy."},{},{},{"title":"Image Super Resolution using Convolutional Autoencoders","start_date":"May 2020","end_date":"May 2020","description":"Developed an algorithm which increases the resolution of blurry/grainy images using Convolutional Autoencoders. Used skip connections between the encoder and decoder to maintain the information passed."},{"title":"Hierarchical Clustering : Customer Segmentation","start_date":"Apr 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020"},{"title":"Human Surveillance System using Deep Learning ","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"Jul 2019","description":"Project Guide: Prof. Aurobinda Routray, Department of Electrical Engineering‚Ä¢Developed a python based human surveillance system for public places like retail stores.‚Ä¢The system calculates the time spent by the person and also the change in the expression of the person at the entry and exit.‚Ä¢ResNet model was used for face recognition and the Inception model was used to calculate the 128-dimensional facial embedding.‚Ä¢A happiness index was introduced to calculate the happiness of the person at entry and also at the exit."},{"title":"Hypothermia prevention jacket","start_date":"Jul 2017","end_date":"Aug 2017","description":"‚Ä¢Part of the team which won Gold medal among 12+ teams in Open IIT Product Design competition.‚Ä¢Designed a jacket that prevents the condition of Hypothermia which wreaks havoc in the community of mountain climbers and the army men.‚Ä¢Ideated the use of heat packs made up of the reaction between supercooled Sodium carbonate and water, which was exothermic in nature. ‚Ä¢Integrated features such as GPS locater, emergency SOS caller which made our product efficient and also one of it's kind."},{},{}]
